_comment: SQL Server BAK File to S3 Backup Configuration - Copy this file to config.json and update values
_server_identifier_help: Unique identifier for this server. Used in S3 path. Defaults to hostname if empty.
_bak_file_path_help: Path to directory where SQL Agent creates .bak files. The latest .bak file will be uploaded.
_s3_region_help: AWS region where the S3 bucket is located.
_s3_prefix_help: Prefix/folder path within the bucket. Final path: s3://bucket/prefix/server/date/filename.bak
_aws_access_key_help: AWS Access Key ID with write permissions to the S3 bucket.
_log_retention_days_help: Number of days to keep log files. Set to 0 to disable cleanup.
_backup_time_help: Time to run daily backup (24-hour format). Used by installer to create scheduled task.
_compression_enabled_help: Enable RAR compression before upload. Significantly reduces upload size (e.g., 20GB -> 1.3GB).
_rar_executable_path_help: Full path to WinRAR command-line executable (rar.exe). Required if compression is enabled.
_compression_level_help: RAR compression level: 0 (store/no compression) to 5 (best/maximum compression). Default is 5.
_temp_directory_help: Directory for temporary compressed files. Should have enough free space for the compressed backup.
